verses.roman:
nanv asau dūram ānīya
śete mām iha sādhu-vat
iti matvācyutaṁ mūḍhas
taṁ padā samatāḍayat

synonyms: nanu—is it so; asau—He; dūram—a long distance; ānīya—bringing; śete—is lying down; mām—me; iha—here; sādhu-vat—like a saintly person; iti—so; matvā—thinking (him); acyutam—(to be) Lord Kṛṣṇa; mūḍhaḥ—deluded; tam—him; padā—with his foot; samatāḍayat—struck with full force.
translation: "So, after leading me such a long distance, now He is lying here like some saint!" Thus thinking the sleeping man to be Lord Kṛṣṇa, the deluded fool kicked him with all his strength.
